user_message:
<misra_rule>
MISRA C 2023 Rule 14.3 is: Controlling expressions shall not be invariant.
Here are exceptions to this rule:
1. Invariants that are used to create infinite loops are permitted.
2. A do-while loop with an essentially Boolean controlling expression that evaluates to false and satisfies the constraints and semantics for an integer constant expression is permitted.
</misra_rule>
<response format>
Provide your answer with these fields.
- is_rule_violated: whether the rule is violated or not (true/false),
- scenario: a specific violation scenario.
</response format>
<target_code>
Here is the code of SHA1PadMessage:
```c
static void
SHA1PadMessage (struct SHA1Context *context)
{
  if (context->message_block_index > 55)
  {
    context->message_block[context->message_block_index++] = 0x80;
    while (context->message_block_index < 64)
    {
      context->message_block[context->message_block_index++] = 0;
    }
    SHA1ProcessMessageBlock (context);
    while (context->message_block_index < 56)
    {
      context->message_block[context->message_block_index++] = 0;
    }
  }
  else
  {
    context->message_block[context->message_block_index++] = 0x80;
    while (context->message_block_index < 56)
    {
      context->message_block[context->message_block_index++] = 0;
    }
  }
  context->message_block[56] = (unsigned char) (context->length_high >> 24);
  context->message_block[57] = (unsigned char) (context->length_high >> 16);
  context->message_block[58] = (unsigned char) (context->length_high >> 8);
  context->message_block[59] = (unsigned char) (context->length_high);
  context->message_block[60] = (unsigned char) (context->length_low >> 24);
  context->message_block[61] = (unsigned char) (context->length_low >> 16);
  context->message_block[62] = (unsigned char) (context->length_low >> 8);
  context->message_block[63] = (unsigned char) (context->length_low);
  SHA1ProcessMessageBlock (context);
}
```
</target_code>
<target_code>
Here is the code fragment that you need to analyze:
```c
if (context->message_block_index > 55)
  {
    context->message_block[context->message_block_index++] = 0x80;
    while (context->message_block_index < 64)
    {
      context->message_block[context->message_block_index++] = 0;
    }
    SHA1ProcessMessageBlock (context);
    while (context->message_block_index < 56)
    {
      context->message_block[context->message_block_index++] = 0;
    }
  }
```
Focus on the above code fragment and judge whether it violates the rule 14.3 or not.
</target_code>
scenario: No violation: the while loop controlling expressions depend on context->message_block_index and that variable is modified inside the loop (via context->message_block[context->message_block_index++] = 0;). Because the controlling expressions can change each iteration they are not invariant, so MISRA C 2023 Rule 14.3 is not violated.
